courses.name: Calculus I
courses.description: Introduction to fundamental mathematical concepts including functions, limits, continuity, derivatives and integrals. Computation of derivatives and applications to optimization problems.

courses.name: Calculus II
courses.description: Development of definite integrals and applications to find areas and volumes. Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, integration techniques, convergence tests for sequences and series.

courses.name: Linear Algebra I
courses.description: Introductory linear algebra covering systems of linear equations, Gaussian elimination, matrices, inverses, determinants, vectors, vector spaces, and linear independence.

courses.name: Linear Algebra II
courses.description: Further topics in linear algebra including linear transformations, inner products, eigenvectors, eigenvalues, matrix diagonalization, and Jordan normal form.

courses.name: Foundations of Mathematics
courses.description: Rigorous introduction to mathematical proof, set theory, logic, and foundational concepts underlying advanced mathematics.

courses.name: Mathematics I
courses.description: Introductory mathematics for CN Yang scholars and Renaissance Engineering students. Topics include limits, differentiation, integration, inverse functions, and ordinary differential equations.

courses.name: Mathematics II
courses.description: Second mathematics course covering systems of linear equations, matrices, vector spaces, inner products, calculus of several variables, and vector calculus.

courses.name: Calculus I (Advanced)
courses.description: Advanced version of Calculus I for high-achieving students with deeper coverage of theoretical foundations.

courses.name: Calculus II (Advanced)
courses.description: Advanced version of Calculus II with rigorous treatment of integration and series theory.

courses.name: Calculus III (Advanced)
courses.description: Advanced calculus covering multivariable functions, partial derivatives, multiple integrals, and introduction to differential forms.

courses.name: Linear Algebra III
courses.description: Advanced topics in linear algebra with applications to differential equations and numerical methods.

courses.name: Complex Analysis
courses.description: Complex numbers, analytic functions, contour integration, and residue theorem with applications.

courses.name: Real Analysis
courses.description: Rigorous treatment of real numbers, sequences, limits, continuity, differentiation, and integration.

courses.name: Ordinary Differential Equations
courses.description: Solutions of ODEs, first-order and second-order equations, systems of ODEs, and applications to physical problems.

courses.name: Partial Differential Equations
courses.description: Classification of PDEs, method of characteristics, separation of variables, and applications to heat and wave equations.

courses.name: Numerical Analysis
courses.description: Numerical methods for solving nonlinear equations, interpolation, numerical differentiation and integration, and solving differential equations.

courses.name: Matrix Theory
courses.description: Advanced matrix theory including canonical forms, matrix functions, and applications.

courses.name: Computational Linear Algebra
courses.description: Computational aspects of linear algebra with focus on algorithms and numerical stability.

courses.name: Modern Cryptography: Real-World Applications and Impact
courses.description: Introduction to cryptography including encryption algorithms, digital signatures, hash functions, and applications.

courses.name: Real-World E-Commerce and DEEP Technology
courses.description: Mathematical and computational approaches to transforming e-commerce ideas into practical ventures.

courses.name: Introduction to Computer Science
courses.description: Fundamentals of computer science, algorithms, and programming concepts for non-CS majors.

courses.name: Linear Algebra for Engineers
courses.description: Linear algebra fundamentals tailored for civil engineering applications.

courses.name: Linear Algebra for Chemistry
courses.description: Linear algebra with applications to quantum chemistry and molecular systems.

courses.name: Mathematics I (Renaissance)
courses.description: Mathematics I for Renaissance Engineering scholars with focus on engineering applications.

courses.name: Mathematics II (Renaissance)
courses.description: Mathematics II for Renaissance Engineering scholars covering advanced calculus and linear algebra.

courses.name: Abstract Algebra
courses.description: Introduction to group theory, ring theory, and field theory with applications.

courses.name: Topology
courses.description: Topological spaces, continuity, compactness, connectedness, and separation axioms.

courses.name: Functional Analysis
courses.description: Banach spaces, Hilbert spaces, linear operators, and spectral theory with applications.

courses.name: Combinatorics
courses.description: Counting principles, permutations, combinations, graph theory, and discrete probability.

courses.name: Number Theory
courses.description: Prime numbers, congruences, quadratic residues, Diophantine equations, and cryptographic applications.
